comment:
The plugin is amazing! The issue mentioned by different users below (like 100% CPU load, UI freezes, etc.) is related to JetBrains probucts, not to the plugin. The solution was mentioned in this comment and works well for me:

  • https://github.com/microsoft/copilot-intellij-feedback/issues/529#issuecomment-3352779192

Really terrible experience. I need to relogin so often it makes it useless. It also slows down perfomence significantly. I don't understand which model is better for what goal - why don to add this? A new one comes every now and then - I can't take care of everyone. And at the same time it's unable to write complex unit tests - so in overall it's useless.
Lately Copilots UI became horribly instable. Cannot create new conversations, often cannot send the request at all.

The overall functions can all be used, but recently I had to joke about a problem. The opening function of the current file causes the code generated in Agent mode to always modify the latest code again, continuously looping and modifying the current document. As a result, I can only close the current file now. During the generation process, I cannot switch to other files to view either, because it is always open by default, causing the file to be continuously modified in a loop during the generation process.

My experience with this plugin was absolutely terrible. It messed up the code completion, the context awareness of the conversation and code base was nearly non-existent, in agent mode it tried to generate the folder structures/files outside of the project directory (I gave it the full reference and appended a file from the same package, but it didn't even get the root folder of the project sources right).

I have no idea about the experience with GH Copilot in other IDEs, but if you use JetBrains products, my advice is to not even think about installing this plugin.

The license was provided by the company so I gave it a shot, but I am going back to AI Assistant and Junie.

Breaks PHPStorm syntax checking, crashes, is extremely slow and it doesn't load all the models that I have access to anymore (for example, GPT-5-codex is only available in VSCode for me now). Why are you doing this, Microsoft? I won't switch to VSCode as my main IDE, if that's your plan.

Finally, an agent coder JetBrains extension comparable to VSCode's Roo Code There are a few downsides compared to Roo, like the lack of intelligent context condensing, which is a killer feature in Roo which lets the agent to run for way longer despite the short context window But at least, Copilot is a proper plugin with an agent feature that lets me auto-approve the changes while also supporting running commands in the terminal and of course using MCP servers, and since I have access to GitHub Education, this is completely free for now

The Copilot integration into Jetbrains is slow, buggy, crashes, and causes multiple UI issues. This has been ongoing for months now. It's making me contemplate other AI assistants as it seems to be clear that it is not supported well enough in Jetbrains products.

Bummer because I prefer the dev experience of WebStorm for most everything else. But Copilot in VSCode is a way better experience. Its suggestions are more contextual and intelligent. I can add a variable to one file and export it, go to another file, begin to type and Copilot is already suggesting what to do with that variable and it's often very accurate. Whereas with WebStorm it doesn't seem to have that context of what was recently typed between files and what files are currently open.
I'll give Copailot another chance

Constants relogins. UI freezes; Not able to select newest model. Just a time waste, comparing to cursor

Only installed it because my coorporation waned to do so, but then removed due to constant freezes.

Also no way to disable telemetry.
The best plugin on my engineer career.
Plugin constantly breaks. "Failed to initiate the GitHub login process. Please try again. " I have to uninstall and re-install/login just for it to work for a short duration.
100% CPU load, are you kidding?

In the last month, it's almost impossible to use Copilot! Unfortunately, it's getting worse instead of better! I believe that in the end, if they make the same product at the same level as the VSC plugin, it would be much more profitable because Copilot is definitely the best AI assistant. I used to use VSC, but due to some requirements, I had to switch to Intellij IDEA, happy about the fact that Copilot is also there, when the disappointment with it there is so that if it doesn't improve, I will have to switch the entire ecosystem to another assistant, and I honestly don't like that thought!

Since recent updates (most notably the introduction of agentic mode) the plugin makes the IDE unusable, most jarring issue is that information per token doesn't update anymore, for example when there is a error token (invalid syntax) after fixing the red font color still persists, and it still reporting the fixed issue. The issue is also per file, reporting false or already fixed errors.

Plus my expectations is when using the chat feature i should be giving the root of the folder and the plugin should handle which files should use for the response, rather than manually adding them. Doing this defeats the purpose.
Why it is becoming so bad ? UI is inconsistent, buggy and keeps dropping results

It almost feels that Microsoft built this plugin to severely hamper JetBrains as a competitor in the IDE space.
It became extremely bad over the last month; it's just messing up all the code, even without asking anything. Probably time to move to VSCode or other IDE with a properly done integration.

P√©ssimo no Intellij, perde contexto, consome CPU e Mem√≥ria, trava o Code Inspections, tenho que fechar o chat e abrir outro v√°rias vezes ao dia. Testei ele no Visual Studio e parece n√£o ter esses problemas, poderiam deixar o do Intellij exatamente igual ao do Visual Studio que j√° seria bem melhor.
Not up to par with vscode
Can't install it, I get an unhelpful error message a la oopsie woopsie, something went wrong

Often errors and crashes and does not work, just don't get any info, just some standard error messages. 50% of the time it does not work properly, one of the worst plugins I have seen.

Microsoft product at it's best...
crash everywhere, always restore file status from some strange cache, and terrible file diff UI feature. I don't recommand personal pay for this.

This has to be one of the worst plugins I have seen.

Every update seems to break something which had been fixed one update before. This time:

  1. copilot-instructions.md is being ignored by every single prompt.
  2. MCPs, though the settings menu works again, for now, are not being loaded and can't be used.
  3. Though you can now create prompt files, they will NOT be used or even acknowledged by copilot.

Add to that the fact that it lags so far behind the features provided in VS Code one can only wonder if the developers are purposfully breaking this plugin to try to boost the VS Code usage.

Initially, Gemini became useless after the 2025.2.2 update, both in Clion and WebStorm. Even the latest Gemini update didn't help. And yesterday, Copilot became useless. It just runs a task, loading without stopping, then moves on to another task, while the previous one didn't do anything, and so on endlessly. This is terrible, do something!!!

I have macbook M2 Pro but when I use chat feature of Github copilot, It starts consuming CPU resource heavily. It heats up my machine. Laptop's CPU generally do not need fan based cooling in my coding flows, but when I start using this extension it needs fan based cooling.
Remote ssh mode sucks
Currently, it's not possible to add the entire code base to the chat, which is quite unfortunate
Copilot constantly hanging on "Working" in all modes (Ask, Edit, Agent); integration with Jetbrains MCP server is not working well
I'm Using Github Copilot Pro but maximum time it shows this error " Opps, The token limit exceeded. try to short your prompt or start a new conversation."
Currently a complete CPU hog, once a chat has opened.

Copilot works well in PhpStorm when it‚Äôs running ‚Äì completions are smart and helpful. But it often logs me out and asks to re-login with GitHub, which is frustrating. It works only a few times, but most of the time it just shows the login button again. Very frustrating. Needs a stable login/session fix.

Since yesterday I'm not able to use the plugin anymore, because I can't even login. Before it was changing the format of my prompt, making it harder to read back the conversation. Also a lot of hallucinations being completely wrong or creating loops.

I just upgraded the highest level of subscription service a few days ago, but now Claude related models are not allowed to be used, so this plugin is now completely unusable, without any signs of making such a change, the garbage company will never be fooled again

Only working way I found is this:

Open the project in VS Code, let Copilot fix bigger chunks automatically (multi-file edits, commands). Then switch back to Android Studio to get instant error detection and polish the code.

This way you avoid fighting the IntelliJ plugin‚Äôs preview limitations.

The PHPStorm implementation of GitHub Copilot exhibits a delay in receiving updates compared to the VS Code extension. Specifically, the Grok Fast Code model, currently available in the VS Code extension, has not yet been implemented in PHPStorm, despite a waiting period of approximately twenty days.
Don't pay for this.
Each update introduces bugs so blatant it is clear they have no QA or any sort of testing. Pretty sure it is mostly vibe-coded. I'm paying for this shit!!
It response incomplete and stop prematurely.

Shortly

  1. Sometimes it's stuck. In obvious cases, it does not suggest anything or suggests by 10-20 symbols
  2. It starts hallucinating. Typical case: I have some code and I need to place "if" before it. So, I type "if " and then Copilot write my rest code with indentation. But this suggestion is not equal to my original code. For example, I had 2 variables: viewer and viewed, and it replaced "viewer" with "viewed".
Best plugin of this month 1.5.57-243. All previous updates were too buggy that Agent mode was not even able to edit simple codes properly.

Promising at the beginning.... now it's sloppy at best, unworkable sometimes!

  • "You may not include more than 128 tools in your request." in agent mode: can't handle much more than the GitHub MCP, if you want to add another one, you will have to disable MCPs not to cross this low limit.
  • Removes the GitHub MCP server the integration configuration from the mcp.json /Users//.config/github-copilot/intellij/mcp.json file (Mac) so you have to add it again and again (even during sessions).
  • High memory usage

Overall those simple issues make it impractical at best in agentic mode.
After the update, the plugin is much better. Chat and inline chat now work correctly.
NES is silly
The plugin breaks down and slows down the IDE very much

When updating from version 1.5.52-243 to 1.5.56-243, I get the error message: 'Plugin ‚ÄúGitHub Copilot‚Äù download or installation failed.' It is no longer possible to update to new versions from version 1.5.52 onwards.

As soon as a chat window is open, the plugin uses 100% CPU. All processes like syntax checks etc. that Webstorm usually does won't run anymore (or very slowly) until closing the chat window. This is probably due to Copilot using all compute power for itself. In agent mode, the newest version makes changes in files, checks for errors and then deletes everything without noticing. Mostly unusable in this state.
